name: Hyatt Regency Orlando

reviews.text: The staff at the Pabody is top notch, I left my wallet containg over $200 in cash in a bathroom stall and it was turned in by an employee to the front desk, when I got my wallet back there was not a cent missing. I was very appreciative! Rooms are lovely clean and spacious. The duck parade is not to be missed!
reviews.title: Very nice hotel, honest staff!

reviews.text: Stayed here for one night in December and two nights in March. The hotel is pretty big and not resrt-like at all - good business location. Close to "The Pointe" which has upscale shops and restuarants. The rooms are nice but bathrooms need updating. The shower curtain is too close to you when you shower and the gold fixtures need to be replaced. Their restaurnat, Cappricio, was great - pricey, but the food was delish. The duck march is kind of silly but people seemed to enjoy. The looby is open and airy. The staff was very nice.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: I stayed in the Peabody for a very large Sorority National Convention and although the hotel is nice they had a lot to be desired. First of all there is construction going on at the hotel. The majority of us arrived on Thursday and unfortunately the hotel either wasn't prepared or equipped to handle such a large crowd converging at one time. Many of us stood in the registration line for 3 hours or more waiting to check-in and get keys for our rooms. Upon our departure the hotel did acknowledge that something happened, but they weren't sure what it was and was working to determine what the problem was and to fix it. They did give all of us our final night stay free of charge, so I guess some concessions were made. I also self-parked and asked how often the shuttle service ran. I was told it was a constant circulation. However, I attempted to catch the shuttle at 4:15 on Monday morning so that I could to take someone to the airport. The shuttle didn't come back to the hotel until 4:43...again, no one can explain that one either. For the price of our "group" discounted rooms I really expected to at least have coffee, a refrigerator and microwave in the room. None of those exist and an additional "hotel service fee" is charged to you on each day to partake in continental breakfast and coffee in the lobby. A refrigerator can be "rented" for an additional daily charge. The hotel staff was pleasant and the rooms were very clean and well kept. It is on the trolley route and you can get to a lot of locations up and down International Drive without having to drive. There are several bars and restaurants in the hotel lobby as well. The stay here was okay, but unfortunately the bad overshadow the good.
reviews.title: Really need to work on some things

reviews.text: We stayed there over July 4th. The room was bright and spotless and the 3 year old liked the duck-shaped soap in the bathroom. All staff were very friendly. Check-in and out was quick. Re. parking, we elected to self-park. This means going to a car park about a mile away. You can enter and exit as often as you like and it costs $6 per night you stay at the hotel. It presented no problems since there was always a shuttle bus waiting to take you to and from the car park. One minor item is the lack of a coffee maker. You can of course use room service or a bar but this adds to the cost - which is likely the intention. Overall, it was a very pleasant stay.
reviews.title: Very pleasant stay

reviews.text: We could not have been happier with our choice to stay at the Peabody. It is right across the street from the Convention Center, which was the purpose of our trip. Before we left we had read the unhappy comments from people who had used the valet service. We did not have or need a car for this trip. But we also noticed that the parking arrangement had changed to a shuttle service to Pointe Orlando. For anyone (like us) who did not have a car, having a shuttle to all the restaurants and movie theater at Pointe Orlando was a real plus.
reviews.title: Loved everything about the Peabody
Rooms are not worth more than 3.4 stars
reviews.text: This hotel was touted as a 4.5-5 star hotel ...the lobby might be

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: as high as 4-4.5 stars, but the standard rooms are no more than 3.5 stars. Quite average as was the bath area, although both were clean. Robes were provided, but no slippers.
reviews.title: OK hotel, check-in disorganised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel charges a mandatory $10.00 per day apparently for
reviews.title: Not that Friendly

likes.disliked: — The unfriendly welcome and staff attitude

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: water!!!! If the charge is mandatory, they would be better off
reviews.title: Great hotel for I-drive

likes.disliked: — 'Lived-in' feel of room and poor A/C.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: just stating the rate $10.00 higher, not to infuriate their guests.
reviews.title: Very Nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hi, we stayed at the Peabody in Orlando in May, 2008.
reviews.title: Not special, poor valet and extra fees

reviews.text: In summary, we felt that the price we paid was not worth the level of comfort and service. The taxes and fees made up 50% of the price. We will not stay here again.
reviews.title: Cute!

likes.liked: — The cute little ducks swimming in the fountain!

reviews.text: The cost for staying at the hotel was quite complicated. Taxes and fees made up 50% of the cost.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: $267.00 for three nights, priceline
reviews.title: Great service, in the midst of a disaster

reviews.text: $45.41 taxes and fees, priceline
reviews.title: Nice place, parking is a pain

likes.liked: — room size, general cleanliness of rooms, friendliness of staff

reviews.text: I took my Mom and two kids to Orlando for Mother's Day weekend to visit Universal Studios. We normally stay onsite at Disney and spend all our time at Disney parks, but we decided to try something different.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel, Great location

likes.liked: — Quality of the hotel facilites. Top Rate.

reviews.text: The Peabody turned out to be a great decision. They hotel is a 4 star facililty with an excellent pool area and beautiful facilities. The service was excellent. We arrived after 1 am and requested at check-in a roll away bed. They had it in our room in 5 minutes and didn't charge us the usual $15 a night fee.
reviews.title: Well Run Hotel

likes.liked: — decent room and facilities and pretty building

reviews.text: We had Southwest flights and the conceirge handled our 'online check in' for us ahead of our flight and printed our boarding passes. That was very convenient for us.
reviews.title: Excellent, but pricey

reviews.text: The location is great in terms of access to a variety of attractions and restaurants. It is on international drive, but on the section very near the convention center. So you can drive or take the shuttle to all the restaurants located on the less busy end of that strip. You name the restaurant chain, and it is within a few blocks drive. Very convenient, and less expensive then eating in the parks or at the hotel. There is also a putt-putt golf on the strip as well.
reviews.title: Hugely Overpriced

likes.disliked: — Nothing included in the room price but the room.

reviews.text: It was a 5-10 minute drive to any of the parks: Universal, Seaworld, Disney. Very easy to get to and signage was well placed so we were able to go and come without getting lost.
reviews.title: Duck fountain

reviews.text: Am surprised to read about all the valet problems because there was no evidence of it during our stay. Longest wait time we experienced was fifteen minutes in the three times we requested our car.
reviews.title: Enjoyable weekend stay

reviews.text: Room was nice. Our daughter liked all the pillows on the bed and the maid scored brownie points for having her doll propped up "waiting" for us when we returned.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, but beware of FEE$$$

likes.disliked: — Fees for everything- should disclose on website!

reviews.text: Pool area is nice as well. Wasn't too crowded when we went (usually early morning or late at night, though) and it's crazy convenient to the convention center. Also nice to stroll down to Pointe Plaza in the evenings. Concierge staff was very accommodating and we enjoyed listening to the piano player in the evenings.
reviews.title: You've read the bad reviews about the parking...it's worse!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only minor concern: seems inside-facing rooms up to the sixth floor can hear the piano very clearly. We kind of enjoyed it but it could be a concern if you don't want the distraction (or have trouble sleeping with it playing because it was still going at 11pm)
reviews.title: Pretty Hotel, Terrible Service

likes.disliked: — VALET = TERRIBLE, serice, concierge, too many children

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the price I paid ($70 thru Priceline) I can't complain about the room- it was beautiful and has a great view of the pool. And the staff (even the valet parking staff) were very courteous and professional. But the fees are simply unacceptable.
reviews.title: How is this Valet service acceptable???

reviews.text: Wonderful hotel. The outside is luxurious with the peaceful fountain The staff was friendly and more than accomodating. The lobby was elegant and beautiful (though very cold). I think this is the best hotel I have ever stayed in. I shared a room with my two best friends and we had plenty of room. If there was room for three 20 year old girls, our luggage, cosmetics, and messiness....its roomy. The view out the window was a postcard with the pool below us. Room was clean, and perfect. Favorite touch was the tiny plasma TV in the bathroom! Our beds were comfty and clean. Free internet that was not at all a hastle to connect to. Oh I almost forgot...the POOL was definetly my favorite. It was HUGE (maybe olympic size), clean, and had plenty of patio space. Maybe it was the way the sun was shinning, but the water was crystal blue-perfect. We were served drinks while we laid out (amazing virgin pina colda/strawberry daiquir). My sister and her friends were in another hotel down the road and she came to our hotel to swim and hang out! Worth every penny (that my friend's dad spent ;) I had such a great experience, I didn't even think about being in a hotel. I was relaxed and had a good vacation with my friends. Wonderful location. I was a tourist but also a guest. Oh and the ducks...who cares about ducks but I must admit that I was quite impressed.
reviews.title: Wonderful

likes.liked: — amazing pool, beautiful scenery everywhere, comfortable room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We flew down to Orlando two days before leaving on a cruise, just planning to hang out before the ship left. Not knowing the area, some friends there recommended the Peabody, and they sure didn't steer us wrong! We loved everything about the hotel. It was very comfortable, and we had a corner room with an absolutely gorgeous view on the 11th floor. The staff were all friendly, and we enjoyed the quiet atmosphere in the hotel. The location was so central to Universal and Disney. We never used the free trolley tickets as we rented a car. There was plenty of self parking close to the hotel. The duck show was just an added treat. We would definitely stay here again!!
reviews.title: Awesome Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Peabody hotel as part of our trip in Florida. Originally, I booked it for two nights, but we soon made it 4 nights, as the price was fantastic! (via priceline)
reviews.title: Great stay in a Great Town

likes.liked: — The 24 horu diner and overall feeling of luxury
likes.disliked: — Limited internet access (but to be found everywhere on the street)

reviews.text: The hotel is centrally located at the big 'strip' and a trolleystop is directly at the street. This trolley takes you either way to a lot of fun shops, restaurants, malls and themeparks. You have to pay a service fee at the hotel but this provied you with free bottle of water and a free pass for the trolley every day. Make use of it!
reviews.title: Comfortable
Nice hotel with some major issues (for me at least)
reviews.text: Location is great!

We felt that the Peabody was a nice hotel, and the staff was very friendly. Our issue was with the parking situation. We were in town for a convention June 26-29, 2008 at the Convention Center. After 17 hours of driving in two days (with a 3 year old), we pulled into the parking lot and were told that the valet service was full, and that we would be parking in a parking garage at the Pointe Plaza. They wouldn't let us unload our car until we had a room, so they made us go straight to the parking garage. We had to park on the 2nd floor or higher of the garage, and the elevator was not working. So we had to haul all of our luggage to the shuttle to take us back to the hotel. We ended up making 2 trips to get everything back to the hotel. It was a HUGE hassle!!
reviews.title: Nice Hotel - Parking was a nightmare!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also used the transportation in the hotel to get to the Disney parks. The first day the lady was really rude and not helpful at all. We got to the park fine, but were told the wrong place to be picked up, and didn't get back to the hotel until 1:00am (with a 3 year old!). The 2nd day we made arrangements to go to Hollywood Studios, and the transportation never came to the hotel to pick us up. After waiting for an hour, they finally got things straightened out, and we got to the park. We were not happy!
reviews.title: Be Prepared for Nickel and Diming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It appears that they are in the early stages of expanding, so I doubt that these issues will be resolved anytime soon.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Terrible Valet

likes.liked: — Great view of the fireworks from our room, we could see SeaWorld and Disney's fireworks
likes.disliked: — bathroom is getting quite dated, time to renovate

reviews.text: I just came back from an extended weekend stay and wanted everyone to be aware of the pros and cons of staying here. Needless to say, the valet parking is big problem but there are others. I've tried to summarize the likes and dislikes below.
reviews.title: Enjoyed my stay at the Peabody

reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: Fire the Valet Company!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at the Peabody Orlando a few times and this property is top notch in every way. The hotel is immaculate, and the staff is superb! The rooms are large, with huge comfortable beds and well appointed bathrooms. It is always kept very clean and modern.
reviews.title: Always top Notch

reviews.text: We stayed at the Peabody Orlando over Easter weekend. The hotel is right across the street from the Convention Center on International Drive, so when the Center is busy it's busy at the hotel. But, when the Center is empty the Peabody's rooms go on sale! The beds are very luxurious and comfortable. We got the Executive King room for our 2 kids and 2 adults. The room was very large and the bathroom was huge (almost too big). The kids liked the TV in the bathroom. We had a really good view of all the attraction fireworks in the distance. The staff were very helpful with directions and luggage. The B-line diner had good breakfasts. We watched the duck entrance and exits -- a huge production number and a lot of fun for kids to experience. The pool is nicely heated. We'd stay there again.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel

reviews.text: I gave this hotel a very high review the last time we stayed there about a year ago. This time i was not as impressed. After returning from Mardi Gras at Universal Studios around 10:30pm-11:00pm, the vallet service was horrible. There were other just small issues but nothing worth mentioning. Just an unimpressive visit for the HUGE charge per night.
reviews.title: Not as good as last time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Peabody over the weekend starting on 4/6 for 2 nights. The Peabody is listed as a 4 star hotel and I would say that is about right. The location of the hotel is excellent if you are going to Universal or Seaworld. It is on the quite end of I drive directly across the Orlando Convention Center. I wanted to be on this side of Orlando instead of staying at near Disney. I feel there are better restaurants and shops in this area compared to Lake Buena Vista.
reviews.title: Peabody ROCKS !

reviews.text: Check In- Check was easy. Pulled up and had the bellman take our bags. Nice feature of the hotel is free self parking. Most resorts in this area charge for self parking which is just an extra change and a waste of money if you ask me. Self parking is right next to the hotel and they have another “main” entrance near all the self parking area. The hotel check in line was about 10 people long but moved quickly. Lots of families checking in with kids. Which kind of surprised me for this type of hotel. Because of all the people in line the hotel staff added extra people to speed up the process. I asked for an upgrade on the room as it was a special weekend for us. The clerk said she did have a nice room on the 17th floor facing Disney so we could see the fireworks at night.
reviews.title: Fantastic experience

description: Hyatt Regency Orlando, a masterpiece of contemporary design and luxurious décor and furnishings, is the Orlando convention hotel of choice for the nation's professional meeting planners. Conveniently located in the midst of the 2.1-million-square-foot Orange County Convention Center, and the only hotel located directly across the street from the center's main entrance, it features luxury hotel accommodations and is a national landmark hotel in the meetings and conventions industry. Our Orlando hotel exudes relaxed elegance, and the warmth of Southern hospitality. The ideal location for association and corporate meetings and conventions, Hyatt Regency Orlando is located just a short drive from Walt Disney World, Sea World, and Universal Orlando and 15 minutes from Orlando International Airport (MCO).
